message.content:
Implement the following plan: # Site Search Implementation Plan ## Context The app has ~20 developer tools (APIs, SSE, JSON Formatter, JWT Decoder, etc.) accessible only through the sidebar navigation. There's no way to quickly search for a tool. This change adds a command palette-style search (Cmd+K / Ctrl+K) in the header, backed by a centralized tool index that replaces the hardcoded sidebar array. ## Approach Use shadcn/ui's Command component (built on the `cmdk` package) inside a Dialog to create a searchable command palette. Tools are grouped by category with descriptions and keywords for better discoverability. ## Steps ### 1. Create centralized tool index — `lib/tools-data.ts` (new file) Single source of truth for all tool metadata. Each tool has: - `title`, `url`, `icon` (LucideIcon), `description`, `category`, `keywords[]` Categories: "API Testing", "Analysis", "Utilities", "Other" Exports: - `allTools` — all 20 items (including Home) for the sidebar - `searchableTools` — excludes Home, used by search ### 2. Install `cmdk` package ```bash npm install cmdk ``` ### 3. Add shadcn Command component — `components/ui/command.tsx` (new file) Standard shadcn/ui Command component wrapping `cmdk`. Exports: `Command`, `CommandDialog`, `CommandInput`, `CommandList`, `CommandEmpty`, `CommandGroup`, `CommandItem`, `CommandSeparator`, `CommandShortcut`. `CommandDialog` composes Radix Dialog primitives directly (bypassing `DialogContent`) to avoid the automatic close button. ### 4. Create SiteSearch component — `components/site-search.tsx` (new file) - **Trigger button**: Search icon + "Search tools..." text + keyboard shortcut badge (responsive — icon-only on small screens, full width on xl+) - **Keyboard shortcut**: Global `Cmd+K` / `Ctrl+K` listener via `useEffect` - **Dialog content**: `CommandDialog` with grouped results by category, each showing icon + title + description - **Navigation**: On select, calls `router.push(tool.url)` and closes dialog - **Filtering**: `cmdk` built-in fuzzy matching against combined `value` string (title + description + keywords) ### 5. Integrate into header — `app/layout.tsx` (modify) Add `` between `SidebarTrigger` and the GitHubLink/ThemeToggle group: ```tsx
``` ### 6. Refactor sidebar — `components/app-sidebar.tsx` (modify) - Remove all 19 Lucide icon imports and the local `items` array - Import `allTools` from `@/lib/tools-data` - Replace `items.map(...)` with `allTools.map(...)` - No visual or behavioral changes to the sidebar ## Files Changed | File | Action | |---|---| | `lib/tools-data.ts` | New | | `components/ui/command.tsx` | New | | `components/site-search.tsx` | New | | `app/layout.tsx` | Modified — add SiteSearch import and render | | `components/app-sidebar.tsx` | Modified — use shared tool data | | `package.json` | Modified — add `cmdk` dependency | ## Verification 1. Run `npm run build` to ensure no type/build errors 2. Run `npm run dev` and verify: - Search button appears in the header between sidebar trigger and GitHub/theme buttons - Clicking the search button opens the command palette - `Cmd+K` / `Ctrl+K` opens and closes the palette - Typing filters tools by name, description, and keywords - Selecting a tool navigates to its page and closes the dialog - Sidebar still renders all tools correctly with active state highlighting 3. Run `npm test` to ensure existing tests pass If you need specific details from before exiting plan mode (like exact code snippets, error messages, or content you generated), read the full transcript at: /Users/jbouder/.REDACTED.jsonl

planContent:
# Site Search Implementation Plan ## Context The app has ~20 developer tools (APIs, SSE, JSON Formatter, JWT Decoder, etc.) accessible only through the sidebar navigation. There's no way to quickly search for a tool. This change adds a command palette-style search (Cmd+K / Ctrl+K) in the header, backed by a centralized tool index that replaces the hardcoded sidebar array. ## Approach Use shadcn/ui's Command component (built on the `cmdk` package) inside a Dialog to create a searchable command palette. Tools are grouped by category with descriptions and keywords for better discoverability. ## Steps ### 1. Create centralized tool index — `lib/tools-data.ts` (new file) Single source of truth for all tool metadata. Each tool has: - `title`, `url`, `icon` (LucideIcon), `description`, `category`, `keywords[]` Categories: "API Testing", "Analysis", "Utilities", "Other" Exports: - `allTools` — all 20 items (including Home) for the sidebar - `searchableTools` — excludes Home, used by search ### 2. Install `cmdk` package ```bash npm install cmdk ``` ### 3. Add shadcn Command component — `components/ui/command.tsx` (new file) Standard shadcn/ui Command component wrapping `cmdk`. Exports: `Command`, `CommandDialog`, `CommandInput`, `CommandList`, `CommandEmpty`, `CommandGroup`, `CommandItem`, `CommandSeparator`, `CommandShortcut`. `CommandDialog` composes Radix Dialog primitives directly (bypassing `DialogContent`) to avoid the automatic close button. ### 4. Create SiteSearch component — `components/site-search.tsx` (new file) - **Trigger button**: Search icon + "Search tools..." text + keyboard shortcut badge (responsive — icon-only on small screens, full width on xl+) - **Keyboard shortcut**: Global `Cmd+K` / `Ctrl+K` listener via `useEffect` - **Dialog content**: `CommandDialog` with grouped results by category, each showing icon + title + description - **Navigation**: On select, calls `router.push(tool.url)` and closes dialog - **Filtering**: `cmdk` built-in fuzzy matching against combined `value` string (title + description + keywords) ### 5. Integrate into header — `app/layout.tsx` (modify) Add `` between `SidebarTrigger` and the GitHubLink/ThemeToggle group: ```tsx
``` ### 6. Refactor sidebar — `components/app-sidebar.tsx` (modify) - Remove all 19 Lucide icon imports and the local `items` array - Import `allTools` from `@/lib/tools-data` - Replace `items.map(...)` with `allTools.map(...)` - No visual or behavioral changes to the sidebar ## Files Changed | File | Action | |---|---| | `lib/tools-data.ts` | New | | `components/ui/command.tsx` | New | | `components/site-search.tsx` | New | | `app/layout.tsx` | Modified — add SiteSearch import and render | | `components/app-sidebar.tsx` | Modified — use shared tool data | | `package.json` | Modified — add `cmdk` dependency | ## Verification 1. Run `npm run build` to ensure no type/build errors 2. Run `npm run dev` and verify: - Search button appears in the header between sidebar trigger and GitHub/theme buttons - Clicking the search button opens the command palette - `Cmd+K` / `Ctrl+K` opens and closes the palette - Typing filters tools by name, description, and keywords - Selecting a tool navigates to its page and closes the dialog - Sidebar still renders all tools correctly with active state highlighting 3. Run `npm test` to ensure existing tests pass

content.text:
All done. Here's a summary of what was implemented:

**New files:**
- `lib/tools-data.ts` — Centralized tool index with 20 tools, each having title, URL, icon, description, category, and keywords. Exports `allTools` (for sidebar) and `searchableTools` (for search).
- `components/ui/command.tsx` — shadcn/ui Command component wrapping `cmdk`, with `CommandDialog` using Radix Dialog primitives directly (no close button).
- `components/site-search.tsx` — Search trigger button + command palette dialog. Groups tools by category, supports `Cmd+K`/`Ctrl+K` shortcut, navigates on select.

**Modified files:**
- `app/layout.tsx` — Added `<SiteSearch />` between the sidebar trigger and GitHub/theme buttons.
- `components/app-sidebar.tsx` — Removed 19 Lucide imports and hardcoded `items` array, now imports `allTools` from the shared index.
- `package.json` — Added `cmdk@1.1.1` dependency.

**Verification:** Build compiles successfully, all 155 tests pass.

The shadcn CLI has replaced both the command and dialog components with the latest shadcn versions. The new `CommandDialog` uses the shadcn `Dialog`/`DialogContent` with a `showCloseButton` prop. The dialog component now uses `radix-ui` instead of `@radix-ui/react-dialog`.

Now I need to:
1. Update `site-search.tsx` to work with the new `CommandDialog` API (it now accepts `title`, `description`, `showCloseButton` props)

3. Verify the `Button` component import still works and scan for other components that might be affected by the dialog API changes, since the new implementation switched from `React.forwardRef` with `@radix-ui/react-dialog` to function components with `radix-ui`.

- Add a command palette-style search (`Cmd+K` / `Ctrl+K`) in the header for quick tool discovery
